items.title: Samsung admits liability in exploded Galaxy S25 Plus case, user claims (Updated: New Statement)
items.summary: The company is offering to compensate the user and cover their medical expenses.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR A two-month-old Galaxy S25 Plus exploded while charging in November 2025, and the affected user reports that Samsung has now admitted liability. The company has reportedly agreed to cover the cost of the phone, medical bills, and cleanup, and has offered $500 per person for pain and suffering. Weâ€™ve verified the userâ€™s claims, including the report from the local fire department and Samsungâ€™s offer. Samsung has also shared a statement with Android Authority, stating that its analysis concluded that external force was the cause of the incident. Update: January 23, 2025 (1:36 AM ET): Samsung has now shared an amended statement with us, attributing the incident to â€œexternal force.â€ Since the fire departmentâ€™s investigation concluded that a thermal runaway event occurred, and per the userâ€™s testimony, the phone was simply charging when the incident occurred, itâ€™s unclear what the company means by referring to external force as the cause of the incident. Hereâ€™s the full, amended statement Samsung shared with us:

items.title: Yungbludâ€™s Australian Tour Pushes â€˜Idolsâ€™ to No. 1 on ARIAÂ Chart
items.summary: It's an all-English double on the ARIA Charts, as YungBlud and Olivia Dean lead the way.
items.body: Yungblud â€™s recent tour of Australia has produced the sweetest of halo effects, as his album Idols (via Capitol/Universal) belatedly blasts to No. 1. On the latest ARIA Albums Chart , published Friday, Jan. 23, Idols lifts 12-1, for its first stint at the top of the leaderboard. Idols had previously peaked at No. 4, following its released in June 2025. With its big push, Idols becomes Yungbludâ€™s second leader in these parts, after his self-titled third album spent one week at No. 1 in 2022. Yungbludâ€™s six-date trek, the domestic leg of his IDOLS World Tour , wrapped up Tuesday, Jan. 20 at Perthâ€™s ICF: Outdoor, with Dune Rats supporting on all shows. The highest debut on the latest frame belongs to Madison Beer, the American singer-songwriter whose third album Locket (LOUD/Sony) snags a podium entry, just behind Olivia Deanâ€™s The Art of Loving (Universal), down 1-2. Beerâ€™s Locket is new at No. 3 on the ARIA Chart, and itâ€™s the best seller this week on wax. Previously, Beer made a splash on the chart with 2021â€™s Life Support , which peaked at No. 36. Also new to the top 10 is A$AP Rocky, whose Donâ€™t Be Dumb (Republic/Universal) bows at No. 5. Itâ€™s the U.S. wrapperâ€™s fourth appearancâ€¦

items.title: LouisÂ Tomlinsonâ€™s â€˜How Did I Get Here?â€™Â Has Arrived: Stream ItÂ Now
items.summary: Arriving at the stroke of midnight, "How Did I Get Here?" (via BMG) is Tomlinsonâ€™s third studio effort.
items.body: Itâ€™s an unusually rewarding week for Directioners, as Zayn Malik gets his Las Vegas residency underway , Harry Styles sets up his next album cycle , and Louis Tomlinson drops his new studio album. Arriving at the stroke of midnight, How Did I Get Here? (via BMG) is Tomlinsonâ€™s third studio effort. As a songwriter, Tomlinson is â€œdiving deeper into who he is than ever before,â€ reads a statement, as the pop artist fleshed out a handful of initial ideas in the English countryside before getting down to work in Santa Teresa, Costa Rica for three weeks in early 2025. On it, the Brit worked alongside primary collaborator and co-producer Nico Rebscher (Aurora, Alice Merton), the finished product spanning 12 songs, including the title track, plus the anthemic â€œLemonade,â€ â€œPalacesâ€ and â€œImposter,â€ which gets a push with a new music video starring James Nelson-Joyce ( Mount Pleasant, The Outlaws ). After an era-conquering moment as a member of One Direction , which went on an indefinite hiatus in 2016, Tomlinson broke out with his debut album, Walls , in 2020. The title peaked at No. 9 on the Billboard 200, and at No. 4 on the Official U.K. Albums Chart, and has shifted over 1.2 million copiâ€¦

items.title: Winter Grips the Michigan Mitten
items.summary: A blanket of snow spanned Michigan and much of the Great Lakes region following a potent cold snap.
items.body: Earth Observatory Science Earth Observatory Winter Grips the Michigan Mitten Earth Earth Observatory Image of the Day EO Explorer Topics All Topics Atmosphere Land Heat & Radiation Life on Earth Human Dimensions Natural Events Oceans Remote Sensing Technology Snow & Ice Water More Content Collections Global Maps World of Change Articles Notes from the Field Blog Earth Matters Blog Blue Marble: Next Generation EO Kids Mission: Biomes About About Us Subscribe ğŸ›œ RSS Contact Us Search January 20, 2026 A winter chill descended on the Great Lakes region of North America in January 2026. Some of the effects were apparent in this satellite image as newly formed lake ice and a fresh layer of snow. The image, acquired by the MODIS (Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer) instrument on NASAâ€™s Terra satellite, shows the region on the morning of January 20, 2026. In the days prior, a winter storm blanketed many parts of western Michigan near the lake with nearly a foot of snow , according to the National Weather Service. West of Walker, snowfall totals surpassed that amount, reaching nearly 14 inches (36 centimeters). The stormâ€™s effects extended beyond Michigan as well, inclâ€¦

items.title: Dom Dolla to Helm U.K.â€™s Labyrinth on the Thames ConcertÂ Series
items.summary: The Australian EDM superstar is headliner for this yearâ€™s Labyrinth on the Thames, marking his first-ever outdoor headline show in the U.K.
items.body: Dom Dolla will set sail to the United Kingdom this summer, where he will headline a concert series at Old Royal Naval College. The Australian EDM superstar is headliner for this yearâ€™s Labyrinth on the Thames, marking his first-ever outdoor headline show in the United Kingdom. For this special occasion, Dom (real name: Dominic Matheson) will take over the Old Royal Naval College, a 17 th century UNESCO world heritage site on the River Thames, the architectural heart of Greenwich. And heâ€™ll curate the line-up, which is presented over the first three weekends of August, from afternoon until deep into the evening. Dom will take the wheels of steel on Aug. 1 with his own â€œelevated, world-class production,â€ reads a statement from independent producers Labyrinth Events. View this post on Instagram The â€œRhyme Dustâ€ artist is no stranger to the big occasion. Last year, he played two-sellouts at Madison Square Garden, and made history in his homeland with a Dec. 20 concert at Allianz Stadium in Sydney. Other dates have included Londonâ€™s Alexandra Palace, spots at Creamfields, Reading & Leeds, Parklife, Kappa Futur, Dour Festival, and he has locked up another summer residency at HÃ¯ Ibizâ€¦

items.title: Teyana Taylor & Geese Are Marcello Hernandezâ€™s â€˜Dream Brunch Rotationâ€™ in New â€˜SNLâ€™ Promos
items.summary: Taylor will make her hosting debut & Geese will be musical guest for the first time this weekend.
items.body: It looks like after Teyana Taylor and Geese make their Saturday Night Live debuts as host and musical guest, respectively, this weekend, cast member Marcello Hernandez is treating them all to Sunday brunch. In new SNL promos released Thursday (Jan. 22), Hernandez leaves Taylor a little confused about his dream to join her for some all-you-can-eat brunch. Related See Teyana Taylor Re-Create This Iconic Angela Bassett Scene in ‘SNL’ Promo: ‘This Mother Sucker’s Psychotic’ Teyana Taylor Gives Teary Speech After Surprise Golden Globe Win: â€˜I Almost Didnâ€™t Write a Speech Because I Didnâ€™t Think Iâ€™d Winâ€™ Snubs & Surprises in the 2026 BRITs Nominations “I’m not gonna lie: This is my dream brunch rotation,” Hernandez tells the group, putting his own spin on the “dream blunt rotation” meme. “Imagine us all at brunch. 11 a.m. Bottomless mimosas. You eat a little egg,” he says, nodding at Geese guitarist Emily Green. “You start dropping gossip,” he says to lead singer Cameron Winter. “And then I get up on the table and start going crazy ,” he concludes, swiveling his hips. “That sounâ€¦

items.title: TikTok Finalizes Deal to Create New American Entity, Avoiding U.S.Â Ban
items.summary: The U.S. joint venture will be led by CEO Adam Presser.
items.body: TikTok has finalized a deal to create a new American entity, avoiding the looming threat of a ban in the United States that has been in discussion for years. The social video platform company signed agreements with major investors including Oracle, Silver Lake and MGX to form the new TikTok U.S. joint venture. The new version will operate under â€œdefined safeguards that protect national security through comprehensive data protections, algorithm security, content moderation and software assurances for U.S. users,â€ the company said in a statement Thursday. American TikTok users can continue using the same app. Adam Presser , who previously worked as TikTokâ€™s head of operations and trust and safety, will lead the new venture as its CEO. He will work alongside a seven-member, majority-American board of directors that includes TikTokâ€™s CEO Shou Chew. The deal marks the end of years of uncertainty about the fate of the popular video-sharing platform in the United States. After wide bipartisan majorities in Congress passed â€” and President Joe Biden signed â€” a law that would ban TikTok in the U.S. if it did not find a new owner in the place of Chinaâ€™s ByteDance, the platform was set to go â€¦

items.title: Diane Warren, Alexandre Desplat, Bryce Dessner & More Celebrate Their Oscar Music Nominations: â€˜Iâ€™m Not Gonna Lie & Say I Wouldnâ€™t Like toÂ Winâ€™
items.summary: The nominees -- also including Nicholas Pike and Max Richter -- share their reactions to being nominated with Billboard.
items.body: For Diane Warren, the 17th time may be the charm for taking home her first Oscar, while The Nationalâ€™s Bryce Dessner and composers Nicholas Pike and Max Richter are all celebrating their first nominations. For two time-Oscar winner Alexandre Desplat , itâ€™s a chance to add another trophy. Related ‘Sinners’ Receives a Record 16 Oscar Nods: Full List of 2026 Nominees Snubs & Surprises in the 2026 Oscar Nominations Diane Warren’s 17 Oscar Nominations for Best Original Song: History in the Making They all may have approached writing for their nominated projects differently, but on Thursday (Jan. 22), the original score and original song honorees are all united on feeling the joy of hearing their name called when the 2026 Oscar nominations were announced at 8:30 a.m. ET this morning. Billboard talked to a number of the nominees shortly after they learned of their nominations. Below are condensed highlights from the interviews. Bryce Dessner, â€œTrain Dreams,â€ Train Dreams (original song) Clint Bentleyâ€™s Train Dreams is such a minimalist film with the emphasis on the cinematography and small acting ensemble that the director and the filmâ€™s composer, Theâ€¦

items.title: Trey Songz Sues Police Over Arrest at 2021 Kansas City Chiefs Championship Game
items.summary: The R&B singer alleges he was unfairly detained when officers should really have been protecting him from rowdy hecklers.
items.body: Embattled R&B singer Trey Songz is suing police officers over his arrest at the 2021 AFC Championship game between the Kansas City Chiefs and Buffalo Bills. Songz (real name Tremaine Neverson) brought negligence claims in a Thursday (Jan. 22) lawsuit against the Kansas City Police Department (KCPD), whose officers arrested the singer following an altercation in the stands of GEHA Field at Arrowhead Stadium in January 2021. Related Trey Songz Arrested On Assault Charges For Allegedly Punching Man At New York Nightclub INXS, AC/DC, GANGgajang Lead Triple M's Most Played Songs in Network History Maya J'an Signs With Warner Records: Debut Single is a Powerful 'Love Letter' to Hometown After L.A. Fires Police alleged at the time that Songz became violent with officers after refusing to comply with stadium rules. He was jailed for a night and investigated but ultimately never charged, with prosecutors citing insufficient evidence of a crime. Now, Songz claims that he was the one being heckled, threatened and harassed by fellow football fans that day in Kansas City. Songz alleges KCPD officers failed to protect him, as did private security contractor Whelan Eâ€¦

items.title: Fugees Rapper Pras Michel Denied Release During Appeal of 14-Year PrisonÂ Sentence
items.summary: Pras claimed that he should stay free while he appeals, but a judge says he's unlikely to win due to the "overwhelming weight of the evidence against him."
items.body: A federal judge denied Fugees rapper Pras Michel â€™s request to stay out of prison while he appeals his illegal foreign lobbying convictions and resulting 14-year prison sentence, though he did win a two-month postponement before reporting. The rapper, who received the lengthy sentence after a jury found him guilty in 2023 of waging a â€œforeign influence campaign,â€ had argued he should be allowed to appeal the verdict before he reports to prison, saying it would reveal huge problems with his 2023 jury trial. Related Fugees Rapper Pras Michel Wants to Postpone 14-Year Prison Sentence: ‘This Wasn’t a Fair Trial’ INXS, AC/DC, GANGgajang Lead Triple M's Most Played Songs in Network History Maya J'an Signs With Warner Records: Debut Single is a Powerful 'Love Letter' to Hometown After L.A. Fires But in a ruling on Thursday (Jan. 22), Judge Colleen Kollar-Kotelly said it appeared unlikely that Michelâ€™s arguments would sway the appeals court into overturning his conviction or sentence. â€œThis court has already opined that the issues raised by defendant do not warrant an acquittal or a new trial, particularly considering the overwhelming weight of tâ€¦

items.title: My Morning Jacket Signs WithÂ CAA
items.summary: The Kentucky band has signed with the agency following the release of its 2025 studio album, Is.
items.body: My Morning Jacket has joined the CAA roster, it was announced on Thursday (Jan. 22). The Kentucky-bred band will be represented worldwide by the agency following its departure from UTA. My Morning Jacket, which has been a band for nearly 30 years, released its most recent collection, Is, in 2025. That album was produced by multiple Grammy-award-winning producer Brendan Oâ€™Brien, who has worked with rock greats including Bruce Springsteen and Pearl Jam . It reached the top 20 of Billboard ‘s Top Rock Albums chart. Related My Morning Jacket Earns Two No. 1s From the Same Album for the First Time INXS, AC/DC, GANGgajang Lead Triple M's Most Played Songs in Network History Maya J'an Signs With Warner Records: Debut Single is a Powerful 'Love Letter' to Hometown After L.A. Fires The Grammy-nominated band has had 12 albums chart on the Billboard 200, including two top 10s: Evil Urges (2008) and Circuital (2011). Of those 12 albums, seven have also charted on the Top Rock Albums chart. My Morning Jacket has also notched six top 10s on Billboard ‘s Adult Alternative Airplay chart, with three going to No. 1, including two hits from last year: â€œTime Waiteâ€¦

items.summary: This week's Trending Up looks at recent streaming hits with some mysterious origins and driving forces behind them.
items.body: Welcome to Billboard Proâ€™s Trending Up newsletter, where we take a closer look at the songs, artists, curiosities and trends that have caught the music industryâ€™s attention. Some have come out of nowhere, others have taken months to catch on, and all of them could become ubiquitous in the blink of a TikTok clip. This week: Marriage rumors help make a Dave and Tems single take off in the U.S., while a mysterious cover of a Stromae song goes big and revives the original in the process, and a new artist makes waves as the rumored alias for a breakout TV star. Possibly AI-Powered Cover of Stromaeâ€™s â€˜Papaoutaiâ€™ Lights Up Streaming â€” And Revives the 2013 Original 13 years ago, Stromae earned a breakthrough global hit with â€œPapaoutai,â€ and now itâ€™s back on the streaming charts â€” this time, without the Belgian multihyphenateâ€™s voice. Released on Dec. 20 and dubbed an â€œafro soulâ€ rendition, the new version of â€œPapoutaiâ€ is credited to Unjaps (a faceless, seemingly AI-powered artist tied to recent trending sounds like a choral version of Sisqoâ€™s â€œThong Songâ€ ), Mikeeysmind (born Mikael Daghighi, a Swedish producer) and Chill77 (another apparently AI-powered artist). items.title: Celtic show 'spirit' & 'resilience' in Bologna as big week looms
items.summary: Martin O'Neill praised his team for claiming a draw in Italy, but big tests are still to come.

items.title: How 55 seconds left Forest's Europa League hopes in balance
items.summary: Nottingham Forest's hopes of a top-eight finish in the Europa League - and a straight route to the last 16 - are hanging by a thread after 55 costly seconds lead to defeat by Sporting Braga.

items.title: Scheffler one off lead on return at American Express
items.summary: World number one Scottie Scheffler shoots a nine-under 63 in the first round of the American Express in California on his first PGA Tour appearance of the season.

items.title: Emery 'dreaming' of winning Europa League after writing off title
items.summary: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery may not believe his team are Premier League title contenders - but he is "dreaming" of Europa League glory after reaching the last 16.

items.title: Who can join Aston Villa in Europa League last 16?
items.summary: Aston Villa are through to the Europa League last 16 already - but with one round of matches to play in the league phase, only two of the other three British sides have a chance of joining them.

items.title: Salah prime target for Saudi Pro League - Friday's gossip
items.summary: Mohamed Salah and Vinicius Jr are prime targets for Saudi Pro League, Crystal Palace hold talks with Wolves over move for Jorgen Strand Larsen, Chelsea consider loan deal for Douglas Luiz, plus more.

items.title: Evans second as Armstrong impresses on WRC debut
items.summary: Jon Armstrong sits in fifth place after three stages of his World Rally Championship debut at the iconic Rallye Monte Carlo.

items.title: NASAâ€™s Day of Remembrance 2026
items.summary: The Space Shuttle Challenger Memorial is seen during a wreath laying ceremony that was part of NASAâ€™s Day of Remembrance, Thursday, Jan. 22, 2026, at Arlington National Cemetery in Arlington, Va. Wreaths were laid in memory of those men and women who lost their lives in the quest for space exploratâ€¦
items.body: NASA/Keegan Barber The Space Shuttle Challenger Memorial is seen during a wreath laying ceremony that was part of NASA’s Day of Remembrance, Thursday, Jan. 22, 2026, at Arlington National Cemetery in Arlington, Va. Wreaths were laid in memory of those men and women who lost their lives in the quest for space exploration. Each January, NASA pauses to honor members of the NASA family who lost their lives while furthering the cause of exploration and discovery, including the crews of Apollo 1 and space shuttles Challenger and Columbia. We celebrate their lives, their bravery, and contributions to human spaceflight. Image credit: NASA/Keegan Barber

items.title: NFL head coach tracker - Titans appoint Saleh
items.summary: Check the latest on the NFL hiring cycle as teams start to fill their vacant head coach roles after the regular season.

items.title: Android 14 is finally about to hit these TCL TV models
items.summary: Here are the TCL TVs that could get upgraded to Android 14 soon.
items.body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR TCL is reportedly preparing to roll out a major firmware update for newer Google TV models. The update will upgrade select models from Android 12 to Android 14. The update could also add support for HDMI 2.1 QMS, â€œSuper Resolutionâ€ upscaling, and more. If you own a TCL TV, be on the lookout for a new update. The company appears to be preparing to release a firmware update that will take its newer Google TV models from Android 12 to Android 14 . Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Google Play Store not showing Android, Pixel system app updates [U]
items.summary: In what could be a bug or behavior change, the Google Play Store is not showing available updates for system-level apps if you have automatic updates disabled. moreâ€¦

items.title: Google Home is making it simpler to add new devices
items.summary: More options to get all your plugs and lightbulbs online.
items.body: TL;DR A new device setup workflow is rolling out in Google Home. You can now search for apps and devices to add by name from inside Google Home. We first previewed this update late last year, and itâ€™s now generally available. Back in October, we got an early look at a new device setup workflow in Google Home. The revamped workflow gives you more ways to connect to third-party devices, letting you search by brand name to find both apps and devices to connect to Googleâ€™s smart home platform. Now, it looks like that update is finally rolling out. Weâ€™ve started seeing this setup process on our own devices with public-facing builds of the Google Home app. Previously, to pair a smart device with Google Home, you had to either scan a QR code on the device or hope Home could detect the presence of a device that hasnâ€™t been configured. With this new workflow, if neither of those are an option, you can type out the name of the specific device you want to get online to initiate pairing.

items.title: Waze could finally be ready to roll out these features weâ€™ve been waiting on since 2024
items.summary: Waze users will soon get toll booth warnings, emergency vehicle alerts, and more.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Waze has sent out an email to users about upcoming features. Five features were highlighted in the message, including warnings for speed limit decreases, emergency vehicles on your route, and more. These are all features that were previously announced, but it appears Waze is hinting that itâ€™s ready to roll these features out widely. If youâ€™re a Waze user, get ready for the navigation tool to get a little more helpful. It appears that several new features will be coming to the app soon. The company says that these features will help make your drive smoother and safer. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Android may be the first official US state smartphone platform
items.summary: State birds are so old-fashioned â€” get ready for official state smartphones.
items.body: TL;DR Utah is considering legislation that would designate Android as the state mobile operating system. Itâ€™s not yet clear if thereâ€™s any real support behind this effort, but if there is, it could become official by as soon as May. Life must have been a lot simpler 100 years ago. Not easier , certainly, but definitely without so many modern-day distractions. Back in 1926, lawmakers in Kentucky first got it into their heads to nominate a bird â€” the northern cardinal â€” as their stateâ€™s official avian ambassador, and pretty much everybody followed that lead with a state bird of their own . Now in 2026, when thereâ€™s clearly nothing more pressing for politicians to be worrying about, weâ€™re hearing about the first nomination of an official state smartphone platform . Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Survey reveals the one habit most language learners have in common
items.summary: When it comes to language learning apps, it turns out that our readers are impressively consistent.
items.body: Credit: Stephen Headrick / Android Authority I came to Duolingoâ€™s defense back in April, after many of you told us in a poll that you donâ€™t think language learning apps work. Despite how they divide opinion, the majority of you in that survey did think they offered some benefit, and Duolingo is far from the only option on the market. Whichever you favor, we wanted to know more about your habits, so we polled you again on how often you actually engage with your language learning app of choice. That question was prompted by Stephen Headrickâ€™s recent article about trying Speak , a Duolingo alternative that takes a very different approach to language learning. Rather than leaning heavily on gamified drills and fill-in-the-blank exercises, Speak puts speaking front and center, using AI-powered conversations to push you to actually say things out loud. Stephen found that focus particularly useful for building his confidence to practice in the real world.

items.title: Forget smart speakers â€” Nintendoâ€™s chatty new gadget will talk to you all day long
items.summary: You can talk back, but it won't hear you.
items.body: TL;DR Based on the character from Super Mario Bros. Wonder, Nintendoâ€™s new Talking Flower toy tells the time and talks at you throughout the day. Pre-orders are now open at $34.99. General availability starts in March. Need another device in your home to make noise at you throughout the day? Nintendoâ€™s got you covered. Following an initial tease in September, pre-orders are now open for the companyâ€™s Talking Flower toy. Based on a chatty character from Super Mario Bros. Wonder, the gadget will pipe up every half hour or so to tell you the time, quote lines from the game, or just kind of say whatever. An overview video published by Nintendo today explains what the Talking Flower can do. The video says that when active, the toy will talk â€œabout twice per hour.â€ Itâ€™ll say different things based on the time of day or the temperature of the room itâ€™s placed in, or on demand when you press its button. It seems, well, annoying â€” and if youâ€™ve played Wonder, youâ€™ll know thatâ€™s a faithful adaptation of the character.

items.summary: You and Gemini could be making beautiful music together.
items.body: TL;DR Google already offers some AI music generation tools, like in the Pixel Recorder app or through Lyria in the Gemini API. Now it looks like Google could be getting ready to add music creation to the Gemini app. Music you make with Gemini would be stored with the rest of your content in My Stuff. Watching an epic action movie with the sound off just isnâ€™t the same â€” the right music can really elevate an experience to the next level. Not all of us are musically inclined, though, which is why we were so excited when Google introduced a new feature for its Recorder app with the Pixel 10 that used AI to help us create music . Late last year, we saw access extend to Pixel 9 handsets , and now weâ€™re checking out what could be an even bigger expansion for tools like this. items.title: You donâ€™t have to wait for launch day to try Samsungâ€™s Galaxy Z TriFold
items.summary: The device will be available to experience in a small number of US Samsung stores from tomorrow.
items.body: TL;DR Samsung says that consumers can experience the Galaxy Z TriFold from tomorrow. The device will be on display at select Samsung Experience Stores, mostly located in California, New York, and Texas. The US launch date is yet to be officially announced. Whatever your opinion of a triple-panel phone, you might still be curious to check one out for yourself. In the case of the Samsung Galaxy Z TriFold , that doesnâ€™t mean you have to wait for the as-yet-unannounced US release date or spend a small fortune to order one when that date comes. Samsung says the Galaxy Z TriFold will be available to experience in person across the US starting tomorrow, ahead of its official US launch. The announcement comes via Samsungâ€™s US Newsroom , which says the device will be on display at a limited number of Experience Store locations. Itâ€™s not the launch, but it does mark the first time most US customers will be able to get hands-on with Samsungâ€™s most experimental foldable without traveling overseas or attending an industry event.

items.title: Google Search now knows what you did last summer, thanks to Gmail and Photos integration
items.summary: Googleâ€™s AI-powered Search now remembers your plans, purchases, and preferences.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google is extending Personal Intelligence from Gemini to AI Mode in Search. AI Mode in Search now blends public web results with your private context from Gmail and Photos to deliver answers tailored to you. Personal Intelligence is fully opt-in, with clear controls to connect or disconnect Gmail and Photos at any time. Last week, we saw Google finally tackle the context packing problem by bringing Personal Intelligence to the Gemini app , allowing the AI to actually remember details about your life instead of just fetching single files. Now, Google is bringing that same memory upgrade to the search bar. Starting today, Google is expanding Personal Intelligence to AI Mode in Search . Search used to focus on indexing the worldâ€™s information, but now it can understand your own information. It combines public web results with your private data to give you answers that fit you.

items.title: Your Android phone can now keep receipts of exactly how it was hacked
items.summary: Googleâ€™s intrusion logging is finally here, and itâ€™s a game changer for Android security.
items.body: TL;DR Googleâ€™s Intrusion Logging is now live on some devices running Android 16. Once enabled, Android records key activity so you can check what happened if your phone is compromised. Youâ€™ll see intrusion logging when setting up Device Protection, and you can opt in or skip it. Google is changing how mobile security works with the new Intrusion Detection feature , which helps you see exactly what happened if someone gains access to your device. This feature is now rolling out to some devices, months after it was first announced, and it could make a big difference for anyone concerned about compromised accounts. Intrusion logging is a new part of Androidâ€™s security tools and is now becoming available on actual devices. Earlier this month, we saw the feature in action for the first time. Now, itâ€™s showing up on devices with Android 16, like the OnePlus Pad 3 , as spotted by our colleague AssembleDebug. A Pixel user on Reddit also reported that the feature is live on their phone with Android 16 QPR2.

items.title: Animations in the Play Store looking different? You might be seeing this M3E change
items.summary: Googleâ€™s Expressive makeover continues as users begin to see more download and loading flair in the Play Store.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Some new Material 3 Expressive animations in the Google Play Store are rolling out now. The shape of the download progress ring around the app icons is changing, as is the loading icon when switching pages. This looks to be a staged rollout by Google, so you might not spot it on your device for a while. Google has spent the past year slowly threading Material 3 Expressive through Android and its first-party apps. Some of the changes are nothing short of an overhaul, whereas others are relatively minor shifts in colors or icons. The Google Play Store appears to be the latest app to get a subtle facelift, with new expressive download and loading animations now starting to show up for some users. items.title: NASA AI Model That Found 370 Exoplanets Now Digs Into TESS Data
items.summary: Trained on data from NASAâ€™s exoplanet-hunting missions, the open-source ExoMiner++ deep learning model uses an advanced algorithm to validate new planets.
items.body: 4 min read NASA AI Model That Found 370 Exoplanets Now Digs Into TESS Data This artistâ€™s impression shows the star TRAPPIST-1 with two planets transiting across it. ExoMiner++, a recently updated open-source software package developed by NASA, uses artificial intelligence to help find new transiting exoplanets in data collected by NASAâ€™s missions. NASA, ESA, and G. Bacon (STScI) Scientists have discovered over 6,000 planets that orbit stars other than our Sun, known as exoplanets. More than half of these planets were discovered thanks to data from NASAâ€™s retired Kepler mission and NASAâ€™s current TESS (Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite) mission. However, the enormous treasure trove of data from these missions still contains many yet-to-be-discovered planets. All of the data from both missions is publicly available in NASA archives, and many teams around the world have used that data to find new planets using a number of techniques. In 2021, a team from NASAâ€™s Ames Research Center in Californiaâ€™s Silicon Valley created ExoMiner, a piece of open-source software that used artificial intelligence (AI) to validate 370 new exoplanets from Kepler data. Now, the team has created a new â€¦

items.title: Tired of Spotifyâ€™s mixes? Prompted Playlist lets you generate new ones on the fly
items.summary: Just tell the app what you want to hear.
items.body: TL;DR Spotifyâ€™s new Prompted Playlist feature creates custom playlists from text prompts. The prompts can be as general or specific as you want. Prompted Playlist debuted in beta in New Zealand last month. Itâ€™s now expanding to the US and Canada. Last month, Spotify introduced a feature it calls Prompted Playlist . Prompted Playlist uses AI to generate custom playlists based on your text input, which can be as broad or specific as you like. The feature has been exclusive to testers in New Zealand, but today, Spotify announced that Prompted Playlist is rolling out in beta in the US and Canada. As described in a new blog post from Spotify , Prompted Playlist can make just about any playlist you could think up. You can ask for tracks from a specific genre or set of genres, tracks originally released within a specific span of time, tracks that Spotify has tagged as matching a certain mood â€” if you can describe a playlist, Prompted Playlist can make it.

items.title: You might need to argue with Gemini to get it to work on Google Home
items.summary: The new Gemini upgrade for Google Home can gaslight and refuse simple commands, until you prod it a little.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR A Reddit user reported that Gemini for Home initially refused to play white noise, claiming it could only broadcast messages. The AI assistant eventually performed the task after the user encouraged it, highlighting a â€œgaslightingâ€ trend in modern AI. While Gemini in Google Home excels at context, it often struggles with basic commands that the original Google Assistant handled easily. Gemini is slowly but surely replacing Google Assistant throughout Googleâ€™s smart home ecosystem. While we wait for a broader rollout, most Google Home users just want the basics to work again. Unfortunately, Google still has some work to do, as Gemini for Home sometimes ends up gaslighting users about what it can and cannot do, as one Reddit user found out. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Weird bug on Pixelâ€™s Phone app might be leaking your audio during voicemails
items.summary: And it sounds like a privacy nightmare.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Googleâ€™s â€œTake a Messageâ€ feature on Pixel phones is not functioning as intended. Instead of recording the callerâ€™s message as a voicemail, it may allow them to hear you in the background. The bug appears to affect all supported Pixel phones, starting with the Pixel 4. If you have no time to go through all your voicemails, Googleâ€™s â€œTake a Messageâ€ feature for Pixel devices can be really useful. If you miss or decline a call, Take a Message can automatically spin into action, informing the caller that youâ€™re unavailable and asking them to record a message. While it sounds like voicemail, the feature uses AI to transcribe the message and automatically store it in your Pixelâ€™s call history, where you can revisit it later. While Take a Message was initially launched with the Pixel 10 series , Google promptly made it available on older devices as well. While very useful in theory, it has reportedly been malfunctioning, letting callers hear you instead of recording their message. Several users have highlighted this issue with Take a Message on their Pixel phones over the last few months. These reports, spotted by 9to5Google , are not limitedâ€¦

At the very least, the OnePlus, OPPO, and realme trio appear poised for yet another disruptive reshuffle, and thatâ€™s never reassuring. â€œ realme by OPPO â€ appears to the new name to give its budget segment a shot in the arm, while itâ€™s reported that the OnePlus 15s and Open 2 have been cancelled , a clear sign of belt-tightening if there ever was one. items.title: Itâ€™s time to give up on Motorola smartwatches

Somehow, though, Iâ€™ve always held out hope that something good was on its way. Until now. With yet another Motorola wearable on the horizon, Iâ€™ve decided itâ€™s finally time to give up. items.title: Still donâ€™t have the Pixel January 2026 update? Youâ€™re not alone!
items.summary: The January 2026 update has dragged on for some Pixel users for reasons unknown.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR After more than 10 days of Google releasing the latest Android 16 update, many Pixel owners report not having received it. The majority of the complaints come from Pixel 8, Pixel 9, and Pixel 10 users. The reports come from different parts of the world and are not limited to a specific carrier or region. Google was already later than usual when it rolled out the January 2026 update for supported Pixel devices . Perhaps it was a holiday hangover still lingering. But despite the rollout having been initiated over 10 days ago, many Pixel users still donâ€™t have the update. Subreddits dedicated to Pixel phones are rife with users complaining they havenâ€™t received the January update yet. These complaints span across multiple Pixel devices, but weâ€™re seeing the majority of reports for the Pixel 8 and the Pixel 10 series. And these reports are consistent, regardless of whether their devices are unlocked or tied to a carrier. A handful of reports also hint at Pixel 9 or 9a not having received the update either.

items.title: Incident report regrets? Google Maps prepares a much-needed fix
items.summary: You'll soon be able to nuke all your submitted incident reports.
items.body: Credit: Andy Walker / Android Authority TL;DR Google Maps v26.04.01 includes code for a new feature that will let users delete all their contributed incident reports. The option will likely be under Settings > Location & Privacy, and accessing it will remove the association between your submitted reports and your account. Additionally, the â€œContributeâ€ tab could also receive a UI update that harmonizes colors and hides the bio input box for existing profiles. Part of what makes Google Maps such an excellent tool for travel and commuting is the abundance of crowd-sourced data. Features like incident reports help add a layer of real-time, community-based input to the navigation service. However, users have little control over the incident reports theyâ€™ve submitted, as there is no option to delete them later. Incident reports â€œfadeâ€ over time as other users confirm or deny them, but, generally speaking, thereâ€™s no way to delete submitted reports. That could soon change, as Google Maps v26.04.01 includes code suggesting Google could soon let users delete all their contributed reports across incidents, road conditions, transit, and trip issues. NEWSLETTER | Authority Insights --â€¦

If youâ€™re a T-Mobile customer in the US , your bill just went up overnight. Thatâ€™s because the carrier is adding an auxiliary charge, separate from your monthly payment plan. As of Wednesday, January 21, T-Mobile is increasing its â€œRegulatory Programs & Telco Recovery Feeâ€ to $4.99 per voice line and $2.10 per mobile data line. Thatâ€™s a $0.50 increase compared to before this date, when the fee per voice line was $3.99. If you have multiple lines in your plan, the total should reflect on your bill starting this month. items.title: Hereâ€™s how Spotify pulled off a legal ambush to stop that 300TB dump of stolen music
items.summary: This is what a modern internet takedown really looks like.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Spotify and record labels quietly sued Annaâ€™s Archive, the shadow library that claimed to have scraped 300TB of Spotifyâ€™s most-played tracks. Annaâ€™s Archive was not even notified of the lawsuit until one of its primary domains was taken down from the internet. However, taking down a few domains hasnâ€™t stopped Annaâ€™s Archive. Like Hydra, the platform appears to regenerate as quickly as one of itâ€™s somains is cut back. Earlier this month, shadow library Annaâ€™s Archive, infamous for scraping 300TB of Spotifyâ€™s most played songs , suddenly lost its main .org domain. At the time, the siteâ€™s operator downplayed the situation, saying that domain takedowns for sites like theirs happen often . They insisted it had nothing to do with their recent scraping of Spotify at a massive scale. But unsealed documents now show how Spotify, along with top music labels, pulled off a legal ambush and shut down Annaâ€™s Archive.

In fall 2025, more than 50 educators and over 1,500 young people across Maine and New Hampshire participated in NASAâ€™s Global Learning and Observation to Benefit the Environment (GLOBE) Green Down, a citizen science (also known as participatory science or community science) initiative that engages students and volunteers in tracking seasonal changes in plant life. items.title: Survey reveals the Pixel features Google fans want borrowed from rival phones
items.summary: Many of these aren't unreasonable asks in 2026.
items.body: The idea of the ultimate Google Pixel feature is difficult to envisage, because who knows what our smartphones will be capable of in five or ten years? However, when your flagship Pixel doesnâ€™t have a feature that another brand already offers, itâ€™s not unrealistic to hope that Google will introduce it to its own lineup sooner rather than later. With that in mind, we set out to discover which feature from another brand you want on your Pixel. Android Authority contributor Zac Kew-Denniss got the ball rolling by giving you some options. His article last month broke down the seven features from other phones he wanted to see on his next Pixel , and he turned that shortlist into a poll to see which ideas resonated most with you. His suggestions included everything from motion gestures to widget stacks, and you should check out his article to understand his reasoning. The poll also invited you to suggest your own ideas in the comments. Plenty of you weighed in, giving us a pretty clear picture of where Pixel fans think Google could up its game. Letâ€™s take a look at the results.

items.title: Android Auto music controls looking different? Google is finally rolling out the new UI

The redesigned layout features a wavy progress bar and moves the play, pause, and track controls to the left. The uniform template will ensure a consistent experience across different media apps like Spotify and YouTube Music on the Android Auto platform. Google introduced the new Media Playback template for Android Auto last year, giving music player apps like Spotify and YouTube Music a consistent look and experience. More recently, the company updated the template with a new wavy progress bar , adding some visual flair. However, most users have not been able to enjoy the changes so far, as the changes have been under testing all this time. Thankfully, that is now changing, as the new Media Playback template is now rolling out to users in the stable branch. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: This massive UST Google TV projector is so good itâ€™s making me want to redesign my home
items.summary: Even without the space it deserves, the AWOL Vision Aetherion Max shines.
items.body: Ultra-short-throw (UST) projectors are meant to be a practical alternative to massive TVs. They promise big-screen immersion without permanent installations, and I appreciate not having to climb a ladder to mount anything to my ceiling. The irony is that the best UST projectors still require something many homes donâ€™t have: space. After a week with AWOL Visionâ€™s Aetherion Max, it became clear that I donâ€™t have a room with a wall large enough, or a layout flexible enough, to fully take advantage of what this projector can do. And if a review unit can genuinely make you contemplate the whole layout of your home to try and keep it in use, thatâ€™s a really good sign. If you have the room, the Aetherion is one of the most technically impressive projectors Iâ€™ve used.

items.title: I wish every Android app looked as good as this one
items.summary: Sure, your app works, but that's only part of the equation.
items.body: I used iOS for over a decade before fully switching to Android. Even today, my favorite part of iOS doesnâ€™t come from Apple itself, but instead from its third-party app community. My social media feed is filled with examples of beautiful indie iOS apps, crafted beautifully down to the most minute of details. On Android, however, I struggle to find apps with uniquely designed experiences. As long as the app technically does what itâ€™s intended to do, it gets a passing grade for most people. Iâ€™ve long wanted to see that change, and I think the only way that happens is if Google leads from the top. Material 3 Expressive shows Google is recognizing designâ€™s importance more than ever before â€” I prefer it to Appleâ€™s Liquid Glass â€” but it only matters if the design system is applied to the apps we use every day. With Googleâ€™s very own Fitbit app â€” the new version thatâ€™s still rolling out, so you may not see it in your app yet â€” I see a shining example of what the future of Android apps might look like, and now I want every app I use to look this good.

items.title: Survey reveals which Android phone brand you thought had the best 2025
items.summary: You told us which OEM came out on top for you, and also gave OnePlus its own report card.
items.body: 2025 was a weird year for Android phone makers. We got genuinely useful upgrades like increased use of silicon-carbon batteries and more phones flirting with Qi2-style magnets, but it also felt like a lot of brands spent the year moving sideways rather than forward. We have some insight on the subject, but we also wanted to know what our well-informed readership thought, so we decided to poll you on which Android OEM had the best year overall. To get the ball rolling, our own Hadlee Simons gave his breakdown when we ran the poll, ranking major Android brands from worst to best based on how their 2025 played out. He obviously considered the hardware side, but also things like software support, strategy, and whether the brand actually seemed to be moving in the right direction. He ultimately concluded that no OEM deserved the top spot, but second and third positions went to Samsung and OnePlus, respectively. More on the latter of those a bit later, but first, letâ€™s see how closely (or not) you agreed with Hadleeâ€™s analysis by looking at the outcome of that poll.

The carrier is also offering this fast lane to everyone, including T-Mobile and Verizon customers.

items.title: Gemini now helps you prep for SATs with free mock tests
items.summary: These full-length tests, verified by experts, simulate actual SATs.
items.body: TL;DR Gemini will now let you take SAT prep tests for free. These are full-length tests vetted by experts to simulate real-world SATs. It is also rolling out Gemini features to Gmail and Google Docs for Google Workspace Education users. Time and again, Google has endorsed the benefits of Gemini for learning. Whether itâ€™s brushing up on new language skills , dissecting topics with Canvas , vibe-coding basic apps and web pages with step-by-step instructions, or even attempting to replace your real-life tutor . Google has now expanded its resources, particularly for students, with a new update, allowing them to prepare for college. Google has added the option to take mock SATs with Gemini. Google says these â€œfull-length, on-demand practiceâ€ tests can be taken for free. It adds that, unlike the unregulated study resources, such as flash cards and mock quizzes, that Gemini or NotebookLM produce, these tests are rigorously vetted by prep test providers such as the Princeton Review . This helps ensure the test questions are accurate and align with real tests.

items.title: Want a QWERTY phone in 2026? Hereâ€™s a Clicks Communicator rival you shouldnâ€™t miss

Unihertz will showcase the phone in March, and a Kickstarter will follow soon. Through 2025, there have been frequent attempts to create devices that replicate BlackBerryâ€™s impact. In addition to projects dedicated to reviving older BlackBerry phones , we recently witnessed the announcement of Clicks Communicator , a compact phone with a QWERTY keypad. Clicks is the same company that began selling cases for iPhones and some flip-style foldables with built-in keyboards only a few years ago. Meanwhile, another company with several years of pedigree is ready to join the race. The Unihertz Titan 2 Elite is the latest step in that direction. Unihertz is no stranger to phones with physical QWERTY keypads . It has been dabbling with them for well over five years, filling the gap left by BlackBerryâ€™s decline.

items.title: This Gemini Calendar trick turns a simple invite into a privacy nightmare
items.summary: Researchers found that when users ask Gemini about their schedule, it can be tricked into summarizing their private meetings.
items.body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority TL;DR Researchers found a way to hide malicious instructions within a normal Google Calendar invite that Gemini can unknowingly execute. When users asked Gemini about their schedule, it could be tricked into summarizing their private meetings and leaking that data into a new event. Google was duly notified and has added new protections, but the issue highlights how AI features can be abused through natural language. Google recently made Gemini a lot more useful by letting it work across multiple Calendars , not just your primary one. You can now ask about events or create new meetings across secondary calendars using natural language. But just as that update rolled out, security researchers shared a worrying new finding about how Gemini can be exploited to access someoneâ€™s private and confidential Calendar information.

items.summary: ChatGPT may require you to send a selfie to prove you're over 18.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR OpenAI has announced the rollout of an age prediction tool on ChatGPT consumer plans. If the tool determines that youâ€™re under the age of 18, extra protections will be placed on your account to reduce exposure to inappropriate content. Anyone who is incorrectly placed in the under-18 category will have to verify their age with a selfie. Since last year, YouTube has been cracking down on non-age-verified accounts. Although the goal is to protect the platformâ€™s youngest viewers, the age-prediction system YouTube deployed has wrongly ensnared countless accounts owned by adults. If youâ€™re tagged by the system, you can restore full access to your account, but only if you provide proof of your age first. Now OpenAI is following YouTubeâ€™s lead and rolling its own age-prediction system for ChatGPT accounts. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Galaxy S26 Ultra rumors are getting even more colorful
items.summary: Things are looking pretty pastel.
items.body: TL;DR Evan Blass says the Galaxy S26 Ultra will be available in six colors: black, white, blue, â€œcobalt violet,â€ â€œsilver shadow,â€ and â€œpink gold.â€ This lines up with previous leaks, so weâ€™re inclined to believe itâ€™s accurate. The Galaxy S26 series is expected to launch in February. Over the weekend, we saw a leak that showed the upcoming Galaxy S26 Ultraâ€™s SIM card tray in four colors: black, white, blue, and purple. Today, a new rumor from credible leaker Evan Blass corroborates those four colorways, plus a couple more. In a tweet, Blass says the S26 Ultra will be available in six colors: the black, white, blue, and purple weâ€™ve already seen. Thereâ€™ll supposedly be two additional colorways, too, in Silver Shadow and Pink Gold.

items.title: Alexa Plus attempts to gaslight user while turning the snark dial up to 11
items.summary: Is Alexa Plus gaslighting you? User says assistant is inventing false voice commands.
items.body: Credit: Stephen Schenck / Android Authority TL;DR Alexa Plus inexplicably turned on a userâ€™s light without being prompted. When the user asked the assistant why it turned on the light, it falsely claimed the user asked for the light to be switched on. Despite having no record of a recent voice command, the assistant continued to claim that a request had been made. As a perk for Prime members, Amazon recently began upgrading Alexa users to Alexa Plus . While not the case for everyone, some users did not appreciate the forced update. Why would users get upset about a free upgrade? There are various reasons why you may want to stick with the original assistant. For instance, to avoid running into Alexa Plus headaches like the one this user describes. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: iPhone 18 Pro may not abandon Appleâ€™s signature Dynamic Island, after all
items.summary: More like Static Island.
items.body: TL;DR The upcoming iPhone 18 Pro and Pro Max will feature smaller Dynamic Island cutouts that will still be centered, a new leak claims. A previous leak implied the phones would shift the cutout to the left corner of the display. The phones are likely to be released this September. Yesterday, we saw a leak that said Appleâ€™s next flagship phone, the iPhone 18 Pro, might tuck its Face ID sensor under the display, in the process shrinking the now-trademark Dynamic Island cluster and shifting it to the left. Today, another leak corroborates part of that story while contradicting another. Apple news account AppleTrack has posted on Twitter about a fresh leak that says the iPhone 18 Pro series will indeed have the Face ID illuminator and sensor positioned under display pixels. Contrary to yesterdayâ€™s leak, though, this one claims that the visible Dynamic Island cutout will stay in the middle of the display.

The power bank can wirelessly charge an S26 phone at up to 15W or 20W with a wired connection. The device is said to have a capacity of 5,000mAh. Weâ€™re slowly inching toward the eventual launch of the Galaxy S26 series. Itâ€™s believed that Qi2 support will be one of the new features Samsung introduces to its flagship 2026 phones. Along with that new feature, Samsung is working on an official accessory that will take advantage of that Qi2 support. A leak has now provided new images and details about the charging device. items.title: Samsung partners with Perplexity to make Bixby actually useful
items.summary: What's this mean for Samsung and Gemini?
items.body: TL;DR Samsung announced this morning that an updated Bixby assistant will be available in One UI 8.5. This refreshed Bixby will be able to control device settings via natural language and connect to Perplexity to pull info from the web. The initial announcement is no longer available; weâ€™ve asked Samsung why. Bixby hasnâ€™t seemed like much of a priority for Samsung lately, but it looks like thatâ€™s changing with the upcoming One UI 8.5 update. Earlier this morning, Samsung announced a beta for the latest version of its assistant, â€œupgraded to operate as a conversational device agentâ€ that leverages Perplexity to answer complex questions. Samsung, oddly enough, has since removed its announcement, with its URL currently pointing to a Page not found error. According to the announcementâ€™s text as preserved by Droid Life , the new Bixby will let you control your deviceâ€™s settings and features by making requests in natural language. For questions about topics other than your phone itself, Bixby will connect to Perplexity to pull info from the web.

items.title: Googleâ€™s Phone app keeps turning sideways, and users are confused again
items.summary: Google needs to add the new Portrait Lock toggle to stable releases as soon as possible.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR The Google Phone app now supports landscape UI, meaning it will rotate if your system-wide auto-rotate is on. However, this feature apparently keeps getting added and removed between stable updates. Google also added a portrait lock toggle in beta releases, but the setting hasnâ€™t made its way to the stable release yet, causing further confusion. Until Google makes up its mind, users can stop the unintentional rotation by disabling system-wide auto-rotate. Back in September 2025, users began getting annoyed when their phone calls switched to landscape orientation while using the Google Phone app. As it turns out, the Google Phone app had just started supporting landscape UI for calls , and users with auto-rotate enabled on their phones were seeing the intended behavior but mistakenly thought it was a bug. Users are complaining once again that the Phone app is turning to landscape, and, as before, it might still be intended behavior. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: This is why T-Mobile reps keep pushing its new credit card, and itâ€™s depressingly obvious
items.summary: The store employee may have more incentives for you to sign up than you do.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR T-Mobile store employees reportedly say credit card signups are now tracked as part of performance metrics. Customers may be flagged internally, prompting reps to offer the card proactively via SMS during a visit. Youâ€™re still under no obligation to apply, but donâ€™t be surprised if the card comes up quickly and unprompted. If youâ€™ve visited a T-Mobile store recently and felt like the credit card pitch came harder or faster than expected, that might be by design. New reporting suggests the carrier is pushing its branded credit card harder at the employee level than ever, making it far more likely to come up in everyday store visits. According to The Mobile Report , anonymous T-Mobile employees told the publication that credit card applications are now tied directly to an internal performance metric called ULB, which is short for Un-Carrier Leaderboard. If signups are tracked as part of how store employees are assessed, this will naturally encourage most reps to push the card on customers as much as possible.

items.title: Weâ€™ve just lost our best chance at the next great compact phone
items.summary: ASUS hit pause; we'll probably never see another brilliant compact Zenfone.
items.body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority I donâ€™t know about you, but I miss the days of a burgeoning and diverse smartphone market â€” not the hegemony of copy-paste phones we see today. News that ASUS hit pause on smartphone development , quite possibly for good, has perhaps just ruined our chance at seeing another novel and brilliant compact smartphone . Itâ€™s genuinely disappointing. Ever since the colorful little ASUS Zenfone 10 launched back in mid-2023, fans (myself included) have wondered if weâ€™ll ever see another compact phone of this quality. 2024 slunk by with little more than a teaser of future possibilities. Instead, ASUS banked hard on the gargantuan Zenfone 11 Ultra. 2025 passed with virtual silence, and now it seems that any residual hope has been snuffed out.

items.title: These are the best secure email services I recommend in 2026
items.summary: Keep your emails private.
items.body: Credit: Calvin Wankhede / Android Authority All those free and popular email services like Gmail arenâ€™t as private as you think. The companies behind them have access to your email account, so they can technically view every email you have ever sent and received. While we have to trust that large, reputable companies follow their own privacy rules and donâ€™t do that, they are definitely scanning all your emails automatically to provide popular features like Smart Reply and automatic sorting. Some even use that data to train their AI models, and all of them are required to hand over data to the government when asked. Your email should be your business. Period. And thatâ€™s where secure email services come in. These differ from those offered by Big Tech because they use end-to-end encryption. They are completely secure, so the companies that own them canâ€™t see your emails even if they wanted to.

items.title: Nova Launcher gets a new owner andâ€¦ ads
items.summary: Nova Launcher lives again, but users might not like its newest avatar.
items.body: TL;DR Swedish company Instabridge has acquired Nova Launcher from its previous owners, Branch Metrics. Instabridge pledges not to reinvent Nova Launcher but is exploring monetization options, including possible ad integration in the free version of the launcher. The latest Nova Launcher version (v8.2.4) contains code for Facebook Ads and Google AdMob trackers, as well as strings for ad integration. Users have also spotted ads already. Nova Launcherâ€™s death in September last year left many Android fans heartbroken, especially as it signalled the imminent end of Androidâ€™s tinkering era as it once was. However, despite being â€œdead,â€ Nova Launcher received a couple of surprise updates in November. The launcher has once again received updates, but they come along with a change in ownership, and surprise, surprise, ads! Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: AYANEOâ€™s KONKR FIT has a brand new chipset for gaming handhelds, plus a massive battery
items.summary: Can AYANEO's sub-brand conquer the Windows handheld space, too?
items.body: Credit: AYANEO TL;DR The KONKR FIT is an upcoming Windows handheld from the prolific handheld maker AYANEO. It packs a Ryzen AI 9 HX 470, 80Wh battery, and a 7-inch OLED screen into a surprisingly compact device. AYANEO showed off a prototype, but thereâ€™s no word yet on pricing or availability. Despite announcing that it would slow down to focus on shipping existing products , AYANEO showcased two new gaming handhelds this week. Both were first announced late last year, but this is the first time we got a look at the pint-sized Pocket S Mini , as well as a powerful new Windows handheld with a surprising new chipset. The KONKR FIT is the second handheld from AYANEOâ€™s new sub-brand KONKR, after the Android-based Pocket FIT . Despite the similarities in name and overall design, the new x86 Windows handheld doesnâ€™t pull any punches when it comes to specs.

items.title: The Samsung Galaxy A56 5G is a decent $500 phone, but thatâ€™s not enough
items.summary: Spend more or spend less, but probably skip this one.
items.body: Itâ€™s been a few years since Samsung has offered its top-level Galaxy A device officially in the US â€” since 2023, in fact. Back then, its Galaxy A54 5G challenged Googleâ€™s Pixel 7a as its closest rival, combining a triple-camera system and a robust 5,000mAh battery to win users away from the simplicity of Pixel UI and the reliability of Googleâ€™s image processing. By all accounts, it was a good $500 phone, offering more than enough bang for your buck. Then, it disappeared. Well, Samsung decided not to offer the Galaxy A55 5G in the States, anyway, making its sub-flagship Fan Edition the go-to option instead. And over the course of that break, the affordable Android market has changed entirely. Rivals like OnePlus and Motorola have stepped up their game, and Googleâ€™s Pixel A series is better than ever.

items.title: What to expect from Androidâ€™s upcoming Transit mode for your daily commute
items.summary: We start to get the picture on how Android will learn about your commute, and which settings it will manage.
items.body: TL;DR Android appears to be working on a new Transit mode, but details have proven elusive. New text strings have started to reveal what to expect from Transit mode, including a training period while it learns your schedule. Transit mode will be able to automatically adjust Bluetooth and audio settings. Our devices are pretty smart about figuring out what weâ€™re up to, whether thatâ€™s our smartwatch detecting when weâ€™re on a bike ride, or our phone recognizing when weâ€™re driving a car. Late last year, we caught wind of another new tool Google appeared to be developing along these lines, identifying early work on a new system for figuring out when youâ€™re riding public transit . As we wait for Google to finish up and introduce it, weâ€™ve got some new updates on what users can expect. items.title: How much longer can Samsung keep getting away with doing so little?
items.summary: At what point do Samsung customers say enough is enough?
items.body: Samsungâ€™s Galaxy S26 series is right around the corner, and if youâ€™ve been paying attention to the rumor mill, you probably know that this yearâ€™s phones arenâ€™t expected to be very big upgrades. In fact, theyâ€™re shaping up to be a copy-paste job of last yearâ€™s Galaxy S25 lineup . Playing it safe isnâ€™t a new move for Samsung; itâ€™s become the companyâ€™s go-to strategy for the last several years. As an Android fan and tech enthusiast, this lack of innovation is hard to contend with. And yet from a business perspective, it works for Samsung.

items.title: No one noticed that Google has fixed Geminiâ€™s stupidest calendar limitation
items.summary: Gemini can finally read and create events from multiple calendars, like your work, school, or family calendars.
items.body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority TL;DR Google has finally added multiple calendar support to Gemini. You can ask about existing events and create new ones on your secondary calendars. This is great for anyone with work, school, or family calendars. You can also change your default calendar to create events on, but the settings is hidden. Itâ€™s been nearly two years since Google released the Gemini app for Android and enabled users to switch from Assistant to Gemini despite a bunch of limitations and missing features. One of those was the lack of multiple calendar support. Without it, you couldnâ€™t ask about events from secondary calendars, such as work, school, or family calendars, or create new ones there. It was silly, and people complained about this repeatedly ( 1 , 2 , 3 ) to deaf ears. Now, two years later, Google has finally fixed this stupid oversight and added back support for multiple calendars to Gemini, so any employee, family member, or student can access their full schedule again â€” with a few caveats, though.

items.summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) has validated Brazil for the elimination of mother-to-child transmission (EMTCT) of HIV, making it the most populous country in the Americas to achieve this historic milestone. This accomplishment reflects Brazilâ€™s long-standing commitment to universal and free aâ€¦

items.title: I've realised I can make a difference - Hoy
items.summary: In a new BBC documentary, Sir Chris Hoy shows how he is using his Olympic mindset to reframe his purpose following a terminal cancer diagnosis.

items.title: WHO expert groupâ€™s new analysis reaffirms there is no link between vaccines and autism
items.summary: New analysis from a WHO global expert committee on vaccine safety has found that, based on available evidence, no causal link exists between vaccines and autism spectrum disorders (ASD). The conclusion reaffirms WHOâ€™s position that childhood vaccines do not cause autism.

items.title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
items.summary: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

items.title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
items.summary: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

items.title: Most countries make progress towards universal health coverage, but major challenges remain, WHOâ€“World Bank report finds
items.summary: Since 2000, most countries â€“ across all income levels and regions â€“ have made concurrent progress in expanding health service coverage and reducing the financial hardship associated with health costs, according to a new joint report from the World Health Organization (WHO) and the World Bank Group.â€¦

items.title: Countries to reconvene sooner to accelerate progress on WHO Pathogen Access and Benefit Sharing system negotiations
items.summary: WHO Member States today ended their latest round of intensive negotiations on the worldâ€™s first Pathogen Access andBenefit Sharing (PABS) system. Countries decided to resume deliberations in January in a reflection of the shared commitment and urgency needed to help make the world safer from futureâ€¦

items.title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
items.summary: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.

items.title: New tools saved a million lives from malaria last year but progress under threat as drug resistance rises
items.summary: This yearâ€™s report provides a critical and up-to-date snapshot of efforts to control and eliminate malaria across 80 countries. The report also presents the threat posed by antimalarial resistance and its impact.

items.title: WHO issues global guideline on the use of GLP-1 medicines in treating obesity
items.summary: To address the growing global health challenge of obesity, which affects more than 1 billion people, WHO has released its first guideline on the use of Glucagon-Like Peptide-1 (GLP-1) therapies for treating obesity as a chronic, relapsing disease.

items.title: New prevention tools and investment in services essential in the fight against AIDS
items.summary: On World AIDS Day, the World Health Organization (WHO) calls on governments and partners to rapidly expand access to new WHO-approved tools including lenacapavir (LEN) to drive down infections and counter disruption to essential health services caused by cuts to foreign aid. Despite dramatic fundinâ€¦

items.title: WHO issues first global guideline on infertility
items.summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) today called on countries to make fertility care safer, fairer and more affordable for all in its first-ever global guideline for the prevention, diagnosis and treatment of infertility.Infertility is estimated to affect 1 in 6 people of reproductive age at some pâ€¦

items.title: Measles deaths down 88% since 2000, but cases surge
items.summary: Global immunization efforts have led to an 88% drop in measles deaths between 2000 and 2024, according to a new report from the World Health Organization (WHO). Nearly 59 million lives have been saved by the measles vaccine since 2000.

items.title: Lifetime toll: 840 million women faced partner or sexual violence
items.summary: Violence against women remains one of the worldâ€™s most persistent and under-addressed human rights crises, with very little progress in two decades, according to a landmark report released today by the World Health Organization (WHO) and UN partners. Nearly 1 in 3 women â€“ estimated 840 million globâ€¦

items.title: More countries report rising levels of drug-resistant gonorrhoea, warns WHO
items.summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) warns that gonorrhoea, a sexually transmitted infection, is becoming increasingly resistant to antibiotics, according to new data from its Enhanced Gonococcal Antimicrobial Surveillance Programme (EGASP), which monitors the spread of drug-resistant gonorrhoea. Thâ€¦

items.title: World marks cervical cancer elimination day as countries accelerate action
items.summary: Today marks the first World Cervical Cancer Elimination Day â€“ mandated by the World Health Assembly â€“ a historic milestone in global efforts to end a preventable cancer.

items.title: WHO promotes lifesaving intervention for small and preterm babies on first official World Prematurity Day
items.summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) is marking its first official observance of World Prematurity Day with the launch of a new global clinical practice guide for Kangaroo Mother Care (KMC) â€“ a simple, proven and life-saving intervention that significantly improves survival for preterm and low birthâ€¦

items.title: WHO and Brazil urge swift action on BelÃ©m Health Action Plan at COP30
items.summary: The COP30 Special report on health and climate change: delivering the BelÃ©m Health Action Plan, notes that rising temperatures and collapsing health systems are claiming more lives, and calls for immediate and coordinated action to protect health in a rapidly warming world. It follows the launch ofâ€¦

items.title: WHO launches global guidelines on diabetes during pregnancy on World Diabetes Day
items.summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) today released its first global guidelines for the management of diabetes during pregnancy, a condition affecting about one in six pregnancies â€“ or 21 million women annually. The new recommendations provide a critical roadmap to tackle this growing health challenâ€¦

items.title: Global gains in tuberculosis response endangered by funding challenges
items.summary: Tuberculosis (TB) remains one of the worldâ€™s deadliest infectious killers, claiming over 1.2 million lives and affecting an estimated 10.7 million people last year, according to the WHO Global Tuberculosis Report 2025, released today.

items.title: Egypt becomes the seventh country in the Eastern Mediterranean Region to eliminate trachoma as a public health problem
items.summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) today announced that Egypt has successfully eliminated trachoma as a public health problem, marking a historic public health milestone for the country and WHOâ€™s Eastern Mediterranean Region (WHO EMR). It is the seventh country in WHO EMR to achieve this milestoneâ€¦

items.title: Countries make progress on WHO Pandemic Agreement annex on pathogen access and benefit sharing system
items.summary: In an important step, Member States started discussing for the first time the proposed draft text of the annex to the WHO Pandemic Agreement that establishes the Pathogen Access and Benefit Sharing (PABS) system. The PABS system is a key part of the global agreement adopted earlier in 2025 to make â€¦
